bug.short_desc: Error for invalid exclude block in config.json

long_desc.thetext:
Go to contribution "qxe" and do
grunt source-all
or
./generate.py source-all
in the ButtonPane demo directory. Then the log below is printed.
>>> Scanning libraries >> - Warning: Invalid exclude block: [u'qx.test.*', u'qxe.demo.test.*', u'qxe.demo.simulation.*'] >> Expression gives no results. Malformed entry: qxe.demo.simulation.*
The problem is that there is no qxe.demo.simulation.* in the ButtonPane demo.
Is it coming from qooxdoo generator configuration?
--------- [sand@localhost ButtonPane]$ grunt source-all Running "source-all" task
Running "generate:source-all" (generate) task Running: 'python generate.py source-all -c conf1731250621.tmp.json ' ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- Initializing: ButtonPane ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- >>> Processing configuration
---------------------------------------------------------------------------- Executing: source-all::source-all-script ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- >>> Scanning libraries >> - Warning: Invalid exclude block: [u'qx.test.*', u'qxe.demo.test.*', u'qxe.demo.simulation.*'] >> Expression gives no results. Malformed entry: qxe.demo.simulation.* >>> Collecting classes - Processing explicitly configured includes/excludes... - Sorting 823 classes >>> Generate application - Processing 2 locales - Generate packages - Generate loader script >>> Done (0m02.72)
Done, without errors.
Move open issues to RESOLVED â€“ LATER, whose last comment is older than a year.
